node.title: Live: Isolating Motueka family at centre of Omicron outbreak says they're 'all good'
node.description: Here's what you need to know.
node.content: ["Nineteen people have so far tested positive for the highly infectious Omicron variant in the community, eight of whom were confirmed as cases on Monday.\u00a0", "The variant of COVID-19, which produces less severe illness but is incredibly transmissible, found a foothold in the community over the weekend when nine people tested positive for the virus in Motueka. The family had travelled to Auckland the weekend prior for a wedding and other events, visiting a Mission Bay restaurant and the Sky Tower.\u00a0", "The January Omicron Cluster, which currently spans Auckland, Palmerston North and Nelson-Tasman, is projected to increase to possibly tens of thousands of cases, with experts warning the strain could infect half of the population in a matter of months. Health officials are calling on eligible New Zealanders to get their booster shots - the third dose has been found to provide an extra layer of protection against the variant.\u00a0", "Follow Newshub's live updates below - app users, click here\u00a0", "7:25am - The isolating Motueka family at the centre of the Omicron outbreak says they are doing well after contracting the Omicron variant.\u00a0", "Speaking to the New Zealand Herald, a family member said they are \"all good\".\u00a0", "The man confirmed the family is quarantining together at a motel.\u00a0", "A local told the Herald their symptoms appear to be mild.", "The family has links to New Zealand's Sikh community, according to the outlet.\u00a0", "The nine infections have yet to be linked to the border and it's currently unknown how the family contracted the virus.\u00a0", "An Air New Zealand staffer has since tested positive after travelling on one of the flights taken by the family.", "The family travelled on the following flights while infectious:", "7:20am - Kia ora, good morning, and welcome to Newshub's live coverage on the COVID-19 outbreak for Tuesday, January 25."]
